  "notes": "$250 deposit to book",
  "summary": "Chris Zielinski is inquiring about hosting a Y2K-themed end-of-the-year party at the Moonlight Lounge on November 13, 2024, for a minimum spend of $500. The rental fee is waived due to it being a Wednesday.",

          New Email Content:
          
                        
                            From: Chris Zielinski <Chris.Zielinski@mlse.com>
                            To: "info@eattaco.ca" <info@eattaco.ca>
                            Subject: RE: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024
                            Time: 11/12/2024 17:36 (3 hours ago)
                        
                        
                            Hi there,Looking forward to tomorrow night!Just a couple things to mention for tomorrow;I would assume we will have a point person there who can help us with the tech and food timing? Is there a name?4:00pm ish – I will be dropping off a little extra décor, a cake and a couple other things.My friends Mary and Gudrun will be arriving at 6:30pm to make sure they are there to greet early arrivers. If someone could show them how to hook up some music before the guests arrive, that would be great. I will probably switch to my phone when I get there.7:00pm arrival for our guests.7:15pm the birthday girl and myself will arrive8:00pm can we have the buffet set up please? Will that happen on the service counter or on tables? I think the counter makes the most sense. There won’t be any kids, so not worried about the height.Allergies: We do have two guests with celiac disease. Ideally, we have very clear direction on what they can eat. If need be, would there be the ability to make a plate if we concerns about cross-contamination?Cake: I will have a couple gluten free desserts for those folks. Should I bring paper plates/forks?Red Wine: As discussed, we want the birthday girl to happy so I picked up 8 bottles of Spanish red that she likes. Please use that as you r house red to start. If it runs out, then we switch to yours. Please charge me the corkage fee for each as they are used.Bar: We will have people pushing to pay for their own drinks. Please tell them not to argue with the bartender, they can argue with me. I will be picking up the tab. The only thing I would like to know is when we hit $1000 mark on alcohol. I assume it will be later?Music: As mentioned above, we will use the Bluetooth and manage all the musicTV: We will be playing a little trivia game at around 8:40 leading into karaoke. I will bring my computer and HDMI cable to connectKaraoke: That will probably start around 9:00pmMy assumption that being a Wednesday, people will start dispersing around 11:00 but we may have a few more people who need to sing.Thanks again for all your help making this easy for us.CHRIS ZIELINSKI | SENIOR DIRECTOR CULINARY MLSE50 Bay St. | Suite 500 | Toronto, ON M5J 2L2O: 416.815.5948 | M: 416.560.9198chris.zielinski@mlse.com | @chef_zee67[cid:image001.png@01DB3529.69609470]From: info@eattaco.ca Sent: Sunday, November 10, 2024 1:15 PMTo: Chris Zielinski Subject: Re: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi CZ,Yes, you can use the TV to play a simple presentation by plugging in your laptop via a standard HDMI cable.Let us know if you have any other questions!Best,TacoTaco Events Team647-692-4768----- Original Message -----From: Chris ZielinskiSubject: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Hi there,Question, if I wanted to use the TV to play a little game that would involve a simple presentation power point, is there a way I can plug a laptop or SD card/USB drive into that TV? I would just need to be able to slip from slide if it was on a drive.ThanksCZGet Outlook for iOS________________________________From: info@eattaco.ca >Sent: Saturday, November 9, 2024 11:09:38 PMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Re: RE: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi Chris,We're happy to hear you're excited about the Barbacoa! However, we've recently had to take it off the menu. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.Would you be interested in our delicious beef birria tacos or Texas brisket tacos instead?Let us know if you have any questions.Best,TacoTaco Events Team----- Original Message -----From: Chris ZielinskiSubject: RE: Event Contract 11/13/2024Lets do the Barbacoa please.ThanksCZFrom: Taco Taco >Sent: Saturday, November 9, 2024 11:28 AMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Our beef birria taco and spicy beef barbacoa tacos are the most popular!TacoTaco Events Team(647) 692-4768 | info@eattaco.caeattaco.ca[https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4wjvL-MtVuSN6X8zc1j6wpPf1GadtxF2McVDmk2PYfNnoXh3xNrxzL0PfmYSCHj-VCnCeXOXNIy-2vK]On Wed, Nov 6, 2024 at 2:09 PM Chris Zielinski > wrote:Which beef do you recommend?CZGet Outlook for iOS________________________________From: Taco Taco >Sent: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 2:02:10 PMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi Chris,Hope all is well! Just wanted to confirm, we're good to offer tortillas and all the toppings so you can make tacos with all the mains you've selected. It will be $32/person as discussed on the phone. Can you remind me - what are your beef taco selections again?TacoTaco Events Team(647) 692-4768 | info@eattaco.caeattaco.ca[https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4wjvL-MtVuSN6X8zc1j6wpPf1GadtxF2McVDmk2PYfNnoXh3xNrxzL0PfmYSCHj-VCnCeXOXNIy-2vK]On Mon, Nov 4, 2024 at 1:25 PM Taco Taco > wrote:Hi Chris,They confirmed they're dropping off the cheque today, so yes they will be proceeding with the back. Sorry about that! Let me know if you want to chat today about food optionsTacoTaco Events Team(647) 692-4768 | info@eattaco.caeattaco.ca[https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4wjvL-MtVuSN6X8zc1j6wpPf1GadtxF2McVDmk2PYfNnoXh3xNrxzL0PfmYSCHj-VCnCeXOXNIy-2vK]On Sun, Nov 3, 2024 at 5:44 PM Chris Zielinski > wrote:Hi there,Thanks for confirming. I’ll try to get a hold of you to talk menu tomorrow. Just curious, you were waiting for the group in the back room to confirm/pay deposit, did they? Are we in the front or back?ThanksCHRIS ZIELINSKI | SENIOR DIRECTOR CULINARY MLSE50 Bay St. | Suite 500 | Toronto, ON M5J 2L2O: 416.815.5948 | M: 416.560.9198chris.zielinski@mlse.com | @chef_zee67[cid:image001.png@01DB32BB.662649A0]From: Taco Taco >Sent: Saturday, November 2, 2024 5:26 PMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi Chris,Confirmed we received payment! We sent the calendar invite as you're fully booked. For food - can you chat tomorrow? Sorry today and yesterday has been busy for meTacoTaco Events Team(647) 692-4768 | info@eattaco.caeattaco.ca[https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4wjvL-MtVuSN6X8zc1j6wpPf1GadtxF2McVDmk2PYfNnoXh3xNrxzL0PfmYSCHj-VCnCeXOXNIy-2vK]On Fri, Nov 1, 2024 at 1:30 PM Chris Zielinski > wrote:Hi allJust want to confirm you received my payment?ThanksCZFrom: Taco Taco >Sent: Thursday, October 31, 2024 8:39 PMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Re: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi Chris,That's great! Did you send the deposit? Just don't see it on our end, once I do I can send the calendar invite as you'll be fully booked in then.Sounds good on the buffet options! Can you remind me, this is for 30 people? And are you asking to have more taco variety beyond the 2 beef tacos? If so, happy to chat about it.No issues with the cake! If you'd like, you can provide it to staff and we'll keep it stored in our fridge until you want it out.TacoTaco Events Team(647) 692-4768 | info@eattaco.caeattaco.ca[https://ci3.googleusercontent.com/mail-sig/AIorK4wjvL-MtVuSN6X8zc1j6wpPf1GadtxF2McVDmk2PYfNnoXh3xNrxzL0PfmYSCHj-VCnCeXOXNIy-2vK]On Thu, Oct 31, 2024 at 11:40 AM Chris Zielinski > wrote:Hi there,Here is the signed contract. I’ve also sent through the buffet menu (items circled in green). I wouldn’t mind discussing having a little variety on the tacos. Happy to pay a little more if that’s the way to do it? I’ll send the deposit shortly as well.I assume you are ok with us bringing a cake?ThanksCHRIS ZIELINSKI | SENIOR DIRECTOR CULINARY MLSE50 Bay St. | Suite 500 | Toronto, ON M5J 2L2O: 416.815.5948 | M: 416.560.9198chris.zielinski@mlse.com | @chef_zee67[cid:image001.png@01DB32BB.662649A0]From: Taco Taco >Sent: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 1:03 PMTo: Chris Zielinski >Subject: Event Contract 11/13/2024Warning: External Email.  Please take care when clicking links or opening attachments.  NEVER provide your password.Hi Chris Zielinski,Please see attached for the event contract. The contract has been pre-filled but if you can't see the details, please view the contract on a computer rather than a phone. Let me know if you have any questions otherwise you can simply respond to this email saying that you accept it, and attach a picture of your ID (we only need a picture of your face and your name). To fully reserve the date, please transfer the deposit to info@eattaco.ca, with the password 'November13'.I’ve attached the buffet menu as well! You can sub mains for 2 tacos each.TacoTaco Events TeamTacoTacowww.eattaco.ca
                        
                    
          
          Provide a concise but summary of what should be added to the event notes.
          Focus on any changes to: attendance, catering preferences, drink selections, setup requests, 
          timing details, or special accommodations. Only respond with the organizers requets, no introduction.

- Confirm that a point person will be available to assist with tech and food timing.
- Extra décor, a cake, and some items will be dropped off at 4:00 PM.
- Mary and Gudrun will arrive at 6:30 PM to greet early guests and need assistance connecting music.
- The buffet should be set up by 8:00 PM, preferably on the service counter.
- Two guests have celiac disease, requiring clear direction on safe food options and the possibility of making a separate plate to avoid cross-contamination.
- Chris will bring gluten-free desserts; confirmation on whether paper plates and forks are needed.
- Eight bottles of Spanish red wine will be brought, with a request to charge the corkage fee as used.
- Chris will be covering bar tabs and wants to know when the $1000 mark on alcohol is reached.
- Music will be managed via Bluetooth; the TV will be used for a trivia game around 8:40 PM leading into karaoke starting at 9:00 PM.
- Expect guests to start leaving around 11:00 PM, but some may stay for karaoke.
